body: Two teenagers have been arrested after a 14-year-old boy was killed in an incident believed to have involved a firearm. Police were called to Thurston, a village in Suffolk, at 1.35pm on Sunday by ambulance crews treating the teenager, who had sustained life threatening injuries. He was taken to West Suffolk hospital, where he died a short while later. A police statement said: “At this early stage, police believe there was a discharge of a firearm, and are investigating the circumstances around the incident. “Police have arrested two teenage boys on suspicion of manslaughter, and they have been taken to Bury police investigation centre for questioning.”
webTitle: Two teenagers arrested over fatal incident 'involving firearm'
